item.title: Elastic Search API's
item.description: Notes on Elastic Search Replace anything within “[[ ]]” with the appropriate values wrt to your configuration. API Endpoints : POST : POST -> localhost:9200/**[[index-name]]**/_doc/**[[unique-index-id]]** { "userId": "1", "id": "1", "createdAt": "2020-01-03T23:00:50+0000", "text": "test multi word" } POST -> localhost:9200/**[[index-name]]**/_search { "query": { "term": { "text": "word to search" } } } Uses exact matching and doesn't analyse the docs. Uses inverted indexing incase there are multiple words in text.

item.title: Spring Boot 101
item.description: Introduction For those of you who don’t know what Spring Boot is, it is a framework to develop and build applications in Java. Several titans of the industry have adopted Spring Boot as their goto Java framework for developing their products, and that is because : (Very) Fast development Sets a lot of boilerplate code for you A set standard for Inversion of Control (Dependency Injection) and MVC Easy integrations, ORM, Internationalisation etc.
